thread.title: Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide
thread.title_full: Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide

title: Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide
text:
In the Know Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide (AP Photo/John Bazemore, File). FILE - In this Saturday, Sept. 19, 2015, South Carolina coach Steve Spurrier directs his team from the sideline during the first half of an NCAA college football game against Georgia in Athens, Ga. A person close to the... (AP Photo/James Crisp). FILE - in this Sept. 29, 2012 file photo, South Carolina coach Steve Spurrier gestures to an official during the first quarter of an NCAA college football game against Kentucky in Lexington, Ky. A person close to the situation s... (AP Photo/Rogelio V. Solis). FILE - In this Dec. 26, 2014 file photo, South Carolina coach Steve Spurrier gestures during a news conference in Shreveport, La. A person close to the situation says Spurrier told his team on Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, that h... (AP Photo/Gerald Herbert). FILE - In this Oct. 13, 2012 file photo, South Carolina coach Steve Spurrier, left, reacts on the sideline in the second half of an NCAA college football game against LSU in Baton Rouge, La. A person close to the situation s... By PETE IACOBELLIAP Sports Writer 
COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) - Steve Spurrier says that he made the decision to resign as South Carolina's head coach because the team was heading in the wrong direction. 
He told a news conference Tuesday: "We've slipped. It's my fault. I'm the head coach." 
Spurrier was in the middle of his 11th season. The Gamecocks were 2-4 overall and 0-4 in the Southeastern Conference for the first time in Spurrier's career. 
He had never had a losing season in 25 previous seasons coach at Duke (1987-89), Florida (1990-2001) or South Carolina, where he has been since 2005. 
___
